issues.description: Endpoint path mismatch between the problem statement (and the client-side template/solution) and the server-side solution. The problem statement and client expect the persons endpoints at /persons (POST /persons, GET /persons, PUT /persons/{id}, DELETE /persons/{id}). The solution's PersonResource, however, exposes GET at /v2/persons and PUT at /v2/persons/{personId} while POST and DELETE remain at /persons. This inconsistent versioning of the path means the client (which calls /persons) will not reach the server for GET and PUT requests, preventing the intended functionality and causing confusing runtime failures for students.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the persons endpoint paths consistent. Either (A) change the server solution endpoints to use the non-versioned path "persons" for all CRUD mappings (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE), matching the problem statement and client, or (B) consistently version all persons endpoints (e.g., use "v2/persons" for POST/GET/PUT/DELETE) and update the client to call the same versioned paths. Ensure GET and PUT paths do not use a different prefix than POST/DELETE so the client and server align.

issues.description: The problem statement and template expect the Persons REST endpoints to be exposed under the path /persons (GET /persons, POST /persons, PUT /persons/{personId}, DELETE /persons/{personId}). In the solution implementation some endpoints are registered under the path "v2/persons" (GET mapped to "v2/persons" and PUT mapped to "v2/persons/{personId}") while POST and DELETE use "persons". This creates an inconsistent naming of the same conceptual resource (persons) across artifacts and within the solution itself, making it unclear which URL students should implement or test against.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Persons endpoints use a single consistent path across all artifacts. The easiest fix is to align the solution with the problem/template by removing the "v2/" prefix: change @GetMapping("v2/persons") to @GetMapping("persons") and @PutMapping("v2/persons/{personId}") to @PutMapping("persons/{personId}"). Alternatively, if versioning is intended, update the problem statement and template to require the /v2/persons path for all person endpoints (and keep all solution mappings consistently versioned).
